question:
During a recent plane journey, you sat next to a businessman who owns a chain of restaurants. You talked to him and he suggested that you should contact him about a possible job in one of his restaurants. 
Write a letter to this businessman. In your letter
- remind him when and where you met.
- tell him what kind of job you are interested in
- say why you think you would be suitable for the job
text: I hope this letter finds you in good health. My name is Honey Linn from Myanmar. We met on a plane from Cambodia to Thailand on 3rd October as we sat beside each other on that trip. We discussed a lot of things and even exchanged our business cards for future business partnerships as well as working together at one of your restaurant chains.

I would like to express that I am interested to work with you as a part of your business especially in the Human Resource sector. To be exact, I have noticed that like 10 stores and above branches absolutely needed to have a Human Resource professional to retain the best performer, to recruit the talented employee and to facilitate the training as customer service and upselling skills, etc.

As you know, I have more than ten years of experience in the F&B sector and Franchise Business as a Human Resource Expert, I am believed that I can be a valuable asset not only at the current one but also for your future expansion.
Looking forward to hearing from you soonest.
